articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: When war last came to the edges of Lebanon's capital nearly two decades ago, Bilal Sahlab drove his family to a secluded mountain town, rented an apartment and waited out the bombing.
articles.title: As war drums beat, those in Beirut suburb have nowhere to flee

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile strike hit a supermarket in the Ukrainian town of Kostiantynivka in the front-line Donetsk region on Friday, killing at least ten people and injuring 35 others, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Ten killed, 35 hurt in Russian strike on supermarket in Ukraine's east

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said he will hold a news conference on Thursday afternoon at his residence in Palm Beach, Florida, his first public appearance since his Democratic opponent, Kamala Harris, selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her running mate.
articles.title: Trump to hold news conference while Harris visits Michigan auto workers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Microsoft researchers said on Friday that Iran government-tied hackers tried breaking into the account of a "high ranking official" on the U.S. presidential campaign in June, weeks after breaching the account of a county-level U.S. official.
articles.title: Microsoft researchers report Iran hackers targeting US officials before election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina will return to her country when its new caretaker government decides to hold elections, her son said, but it was not clear if she would contest.
articles.title: Sheikh Hasina will return to Bangladesh for elections, her son says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro on Thursday said he has signed a resolution to block access to social media platform X in the country for 10 days.
articles.title: Venezuela's Maduro signs decree blocking X access for 10 days

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Catalan separatist leader Carles Puigdemont was headed back to Belgium on Friday, having eluded police after appearing at a rally in Barcelona despite a warrant for his arrest in Spain, his party said.
articles.title: Catalan separatist Puigdemont heads for Belgium after dodging arrest in Spain, party says

articles.author: Hatem Khaled, Mohammed Salem
articles.description: A newly opened camp for displaced Palestinians with disabilities is providing some much needed help for around 100 vulnerable people in the town of Deir al-Balah in the central area of the war-ravaged Gaza Strip.
articles.title: New Gaza camp offers relief for Palestinians with disabilities amid war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A weakened Debby churned further north along the U.S. East Coast on Friday, spawning tornadoes and spreading heavy rains that could cause catastrophic flooding from Maryland to Vermont before the one-time hurricane blows out to sea.
articles.title: Debby picks up speed, spreading heavy rain along US East Coast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Extreme rainfall and severe flooding in China led to a near doubling in economic losses from natural disasters in July from a year earlier, the government said.
articles.title: China's rains and floods led to near doubling of natural disaster losses in July
